name: Causal Inference for the Brave and True
description: The best free intro to causal inference. DiD, IV, RDD, synthetic control — all with Python code you can run. No fluff.

name: The Effect
description: DAGs that don't suck. Nick HK explains causality like he's at a whiteboard, not a lectern. Free, modern, and actually enjoyable to read.

name: Causal Inference: The Mixtape
description: Scott Cunningham's guide — reads like a conversation, not a textbook. Code in Stata, R, and Python.

name: CausalML (Uber) Documentation
description: Synthetic data tutorials that feel like a game. Generate fake users, apply treatment, challenge yourself to recover the effect using Random Forest.

name: EconML Documentation
description: Microsoft's library for ML-based causal inference. Tutorials on heterogeneous treatment effects, double ML, and more.

name: DoWhy Library
description: Microsoft's causal inference library. Great for understanding causal graphs and robustness checks.

name: Causal ML Book (Chernozhukov et al.)
description: Applied Causal Inference Powered by ML and AI. Double/debiased ML, heterogeneous effects, and modern methods from the pioneers.

name: DoWhy User Guide
description: Microsoft's causal inference library. Graph-based causal inference, discovery algorithms, and Python implementations. Free official docs.

name: PyMC Labs Blog
description: Bayesian causal inference done right. MCMC, probabilistic programming, and causal models from the PyMC team.

name: CausalPy
description: Synthetic controls that feel like scikit-learn. Built on PyMC, perfect for quasi-experiments when you can't randomize.

name: Andrew Gelman's Blog
description: Stats, causal inference, experiment pitfalls. Frank, often funny, always insightful. The most-read stats blog for good reason.

name: Applied Econometrics Notes (Lal)
description: Applied econometrics notes and code by Apoorva Lal covering modern causal inference methods.

name: A Practitioner's Guide to DiD
description: Jonathan Roth et al.'s comprehensive guide to modern difference-in-differences. Staggered timing, pre-trends, and new estimators.

name: Causal RL Bridges
description: Educational resource on the synergies between causal inference and reinforcement learning. Includes code examples for optimal control using causal agents.

name: Eppo's Experimentation Guides
description: Practical guides on experiment design, stats engines, CUPED, and common pitfalls. Written by practitioners.

name: A/B Testing on Social Networks
description: Simulates a social graph in Python to prove why network effects ruin experiments, then shows cluster-based fixes.

name: DoorDash: Switchback Tests
description: Why treating one user affects another in marketplaces. Clear diagrams explaining interference as a living organism, not a static dataset.

name: Understanding Switchback Experiments (2024)
description: A modern take on SUTVA violations. Why you randomize time, not users, in marketplaces. The 30-minute window trick explained.

name: Uber: Making Experiment Evaluation 100x Faster
description: When your p-value calculation has billions of rows. The engineering reality of running causal inference at Uber scale.

name: Nextmv: Switchback Testing
description: Documentation that reads like a tutorial. Exact logic to split time into windows and washout periods for network A/B tests in Python.

name: Matteo Courthoud: Understanding CUPED
description: The most accessible yet rigorous CUPED explanation. Derives the math showing variance reduction is proportional to (1-ρ²), compares with autoregression and difference-in-differences. Perfect for economists.

name: Bytepawn: CUPED in Python
description: Short, punchy script simulating 1,000 experiments to prove variance actually goes down. Very satisfying to run.

name: Statsig Resources
description: Deep dives on sequential testing, variance reduction, and experiment analysis. Free stats engine docs.

name: Evan Miller's A/B Testing Tools
description: Best-in-class visual, interactive calculators for sample size, chi-squared tests, sequential sampling. Cited in Udacity's Google A/B testing course. Helps practitioners understand 'under the hood' statistics while planning experiments.

name: Evan Miller: How Not To Run an A/B Test
description: The article that taught the industry why peeking at p-values is a sin. Short, lethal, career-saving.

name: QuantEcon Lectures
description: High-quality computational economics in Python and Julia. Dynamic programming, time series, asset pricing — all with code.

name: Coding for Economists
description: Arthur Turrell's practical guide. Python basics through advanced workflows — built specifically for econ researchers.

name: The Missing Semester (MIT)
description: Command line, Git, debugging, shell scripting. The CS skills they don't teach in econ PhD programs but you absolutely need.

name: Beyond Jupyter
description: Software design principles for ML applications. Go from messy notebooks to maintainable, modular code with OOP essentials and refactoring guides.

name: fast.ai Practical Deep Learning
description: Train a model in 10 minutes. Understand why it works later. Jeremy Howard's famous 'code first, theory second' approach to deep learning.

name: Introduction to Statistical Learning
description: The 'I actually finished this one' ML book. Free with runnable Python code. Math when you need it, intuition first.

name: The Elements of Statistical Learning
description: The more rigorous sibling of ISLR. Hastie, Tibshirani, and Friedman's classic on statistical learning theory. Free PDF from Stanford.

name: Forecasting: Principles and Practice
description: Rob Hyndman's free book on time series forecasting. ARIMA, ETS, hierarchical forecasting — with R code.

name: Reinforcement Learning: An Introduction
description: Sutton & Barto's classic. The definitive RL textbook, free from the authors.

name: OpenAI Spinning Up
description: OpenAI's intro to deep RL. Clear explanations of policy gradients, Q-learning, and working code.

name: David Silver RL Course
description: DeepMind's David Silver teaches RL from scratch. The lectures that trained a generation of RL researchers.

name: Machine Learning Specialization
description: Andrew Ng's foundational ML course on Coursera. Covers supervised/unsupervised learning, neural networks, and best practices.

name: Deep Learning Specialization
description: Andrew Ng's deep learning sequence. CNNs, RNNs, transformers, and practical AI project structuring.

name: The Theory and Practice of Revenue Management
description: Talluri & van Ryzin's comprehensive textbook. Dynamic pricing, capacity allocation, overbooking — the bible of RM.

name: Dynamic Pricing with Contextual Bandits
description: Exploration-exploitation trade-off using a restaurant menu example. Simulate greedy vs Thompson Sampling to see which makes more money.

name: Stanford: Thompson Sampling Tutorial
description: Don't let 'Stanford' scare you. The accompanying Python code is the industry standard for bandit algorithms from scratch.

name: Stitch Fix: Algorithms Tour
description: The single best piece of data journalism in tech. Interactive, animated tour of how they combine styles, logistics, and feedback loops.

name: Empirical IO: Coding BLP
description: Matteo Courthoud's code-first walkthrough of the BLP demand model. The 'Brave and True' for structural economics.

name: PyBLP: Demand Estimation
description: QuantEcon tutorial on estimating demand curves with Python. Turns PhD-level IO into a solvable Problem().solve().

name: QuantEcon: First-Price & Second-Price Auctions
description: Python simulations proving Revenue Equivalence. Code to solve BNE when closed-form solutions don't exist.

name: MatchingMarkets.py
description: Gale-Shapley stable matching in Python. How to match riders to drivers, students to schools, organs to patients.

name: Auctions in Ad Tech (Sanjiv Das)
description: GSP auctions, quality scores, AdRank — how Google/Meta ad auctions actually work. Chapter 21.

name: CS269I: Incentives in Computer Science
description: Roughgarden's famous course. Why Bitcoin is an auction, how selfish routing breaks the internet, and Price of Anarchy — explained for coders.

name: Susan Athey: ML & Causal Inference Course
description: Stanford GSB's ML and Causal Inference short course. Videos, slides, and tutorials on causal forests, treatment effects, and policy evaluation.

name: Michael Ostrovsky: Market Design Course
description: Stanford GSB's market design expert. Course materials on auctions, matching markets, and platform dynamics. Advised Airbnb, LinkedIn, Google.

name: Netflix Tech Blog - Experimentation
description: Multiple posts covering platform architecture, sequential testing implementation, confidence intervals for non-normal distributions, and contextual bandits. Demonstrates how a world-class experimentation platform enables science at scale.

name: Uber Engineering
description: Surge pricing, marketplace design, causal inference at scale. See how researchers tackle real problems at Uber.

name: Airbnb Engineering - Data Science
description: Experimentation platform design, interference in experiments, and applied causal inference from Airbnb's data science team.

name: Spotify R&D
description: How do you recommend songs to 500M users? Personalization, search, and ML at audio scale.

name: DoorDash Engineering
description: marketplace analytics, delivery optimization, and experimentation. Great posts on real-time pricing and logistics.

name: Lyft Engineering
description: Rideshare economics, causal inference, and marketplace experiments. Practical posts from Lyft's economics and data science teams.

name: Lyft: Causal Forecasting at Scale
description: How Lyft combines causal inference with forecasting for pricing. The bridge between 'what happened' and 'what will happen'.

name: Digitopoly (Joshua Gans)
description: platform dynamics and digital strategy from a leading IO researcher. Network effects, two-sided markets, and antitrust.

name: Stratechery (Ben Thompson)
description: The gold standard for tech strategy analysis. Aggregation theory, platform dynamics, and business model breakdowns.

name: The Operating System (John Brewton)
description: The firm as a mechanism design problem. How zero marginal costs and network effects rewrote the economics of tech companies.

name: Lyft: Quantifying Efficiency in Ridesharing
description: Efficiency isn't speed—it's an economic equilibrium. A masterclass in defining the objective function for marketplace optimization.

name: Noahpinion (Noah Smith)
description: applied analytics, AI, innovation, growth. Deep dives with data, accessible to non-specialists. The researcher's tech newsletter.

name: New Things Under the Sun (Matt Clancy)
description: innovation research research summaries. Academic findings on R&D, productivity, and science — in plain language.

name: Platform Papers
description: Platform competition and network effects. Academics summarizing their own research on marketplaces and big tech.

name: Marginal Revolution (Tyler Cowen)
description: The econ blog. Tech, innovation, markets — prolific, eclectic, and influential. A daily must-read.

name: Ben Evans Newsletter
description: Tech market trends and strategic analysis. What's happening in tech and why it matters.

name: Stitch Fix Algorithms Blog
description: Demand forecasting, inventory optimization, and personalization. Unique blend of fashion retail + serious data science.

name: Meta Engineering - Data Science
description: Large-scale experimentation, ML infrastructure, and data discovery at Facebook scale. Posts on causal inference and data tools.

name: LinkedIn Engineering - Experimentation
description: 41K concurrent A/B tests on 700M members. Network effects, inclusive product testing, and experimentation infrastructure.

name: Pinterest Engineering - Data Science
description: Visual discovery engine, recommendation systems, and ML at scale. Feature engineering and personalization.

name: Instacart Tech Blog
description: Marketplace balancing, delivery optimization, demand forecasting. Making on-demand grocery profitable.

name: Stripe Engineering
description: Payment economics, fraud detection ML, financial data infrastructure. Building economic infrastructure for the internet.

name: Booking.com Tech Blog
description: Travel marketplace experimentation at massive scale. A/B testing, recommender systems, and pricing optimization.

name: Amazon Science
description: Research from Amazon's scientists. Causal inference, supply chain optimization, pricing, and forecasting.

name: Mode SQL Tutorial
description: Interactive SQL lessons from basic to advanced. Great for learning JOINs, window functions, and subqueries with a real database.

name: SQLBolt
description: Learn SQL with interactive exercises. No setup required — run queries right in the browser. Perfect for beginners.

name: LeetCode SQL 50
description: 50 essential SQL problems to master for interviews. CTEs, window functions, and common patterns used at FAANG.

name: DuckDB Documentation
description: Modern in-process SQL database. Runs on your laptop, reads Parquet directly, and is perfect for analytics. The new pandas killer.

name: NeetCode
description: Curated LeetCode roadmap organized by pattern. Video explanations that actually make sense. The modern way to prep for coding interviews.

name: Blind 75
description: The 75 most important LeetCode problems. Arrays, strings, trees, graphs, DP — if you can solve these, you can handle any interview.

name: LeetCode Patterns
description: 14 patterns to solve any coding interview question. Two pointers, sliding window, BFS/DFS, and more — with Python templates.

name: Automate the Boring Stuff with Python
description: The best free Python book for non-programmers. Web scraping, Excel automation, file management — practical skills for data work.

name: Scrapy Documentation
description: The industrial-strength web scraping framework for Python. Build spiders, handle anti-bot measures, and scale to millions of pages.

name: Real Python: Web Scraping
description: Practical guide to scraping with BeautifulSoup and requests. Parse HTML, handle pagination, and extract structured data.

name: Python for Econometrics
description: Kevin Sheppard's comprehensive intro for researchers. NumPy, pandas, statsmodels, and econometric applications.

name: Think Stats
description: Introduction to probability and statistics with Python. Exploratory data analysis, hypothesis testing, and Bayesian methods.

name: Statistical Rethinking
description: Richard McElreath's Bayesian approach to statistics. PyMC3 translations available. The book that changed how many think about inference.

name: Adam Fishman Newsletter
description: Ex-Patreon/Reforge. Growth loops, product strategy, and how to structure product analytics.

name: Sequoia: Data-Informed Product Building
description: Metric hierarchies, North Star metrics, and building data-informed products. The definitive framework for product metrics.

name: MeasuringU
description: Survey science, conjoint analysis, and quantitative UX research. Statistical rigor for product research.

name: Convex Optimization (Boyd & Vandenberghe)
description: The bible of convex optimization — free online, universally cited. Covers LP, QP, SDP, and more.

name: Stanford EE364A (YouTube)
description: Boyd's legendary lectures on convex optimization. The gold standard for learning optimization theory.

name: Modeling Discrete Optimization (Coursera)
description: University of Melbourne's course on constraint programming, local search, and MIP. Covers MiniZinc modeling language.

name: CVXPY Short Course
description: Hands-on convex optimization in Python. Learn to model and solve real problems with CVXPY.

name: Agentic AI (DeepLearning.AI)
description: Andrew Ng on the four agentic design patterns — reflection, tool use, planning, multi-agent. Start here.

name: AI Agents in LangGraph (DeepLearning.AI)
description: Build agents from scratch with Harrison Chase. State machines, tool calling, and human-in-the-loop.

name: Building Effective Agents (Anthropic)
description: Design patterns from Claude's creators. The best practitioner guide on when and how to build agents.

name: Walmart Global Tech
description: AI-driven retail tech, supply chain optimization, agentic AI, and developer experience. Posts on LLMs for product catalogs, delivery optimization, and cross-lingual search.

name: Coursera Pricing Strategy Optimization (UVA/BCG)
description: Price elasticity, WTP estimation, segmentation — free to audit

name: Chargebee: SaaS Pricing Models Guide
description: Usage-based pricing, value metrics, packaging strategies — free

name: Monetizing Innovation (Ramanujam)
description: The industry bible — design products around price, not vice versa

name: OpenView SaaS Pricing Guide
description: Free playbooks on usage-based pricing

name: Lenny's Podcast: Madhavan Ramanujam
description: 90 minutes on WTP conversations and behavioral pricing

name: Roughgarden: Algorithmic Game Theory (40 lectures)
description: Free Stanford lectures — theoretical foundation

name: Twenty Lectures on Algorithmic Game Theory
description: Bridges CS and economics with ad case studies

name: Display Advertising with Real-Time Bidding
description: Free comprehensive RTB coverage on arXiv

name: GSP Auction Paper (Edelman et al., AER 2007)
description: Foundational paper on search advertising auctions

name: AdKDD Workshop Papers
description: Applied research from Google, Meta, Amazon

name: PyMC-Marketing CLV Quickstart
description: CLV basics, RFM analysis, BG/NBD models — free official docs

name: PyMC-Marketing Documentation
description: BG/NBD and Gamma-Gamma CLV tutorials

name: Google Analytics for Marketing
description: Free analytics for marketing — official Google tutorials

name: Bruce Hardie's CLV Papers
description: Mathematical foundations of CLV models

name: Lyft Engineering: LTV Curves
description: Production CLV and Thompson sampling

name: MIT 15.S08 FinTech (Gary Gensler)
description: 12 lectures from former SEC Chair on AI in finance, risk, and compliance — free

name: Stanford CS224W: GNN for Fraud
description: Three-level tutorial from Stanford graph ML course

name: Stripe: ML for Fraud Protection
description: The definitive intro: features, precision-recall tradeoffs, break-even calculations

name: Fraud Detection Handbook (ULB)
description: From the team that created the Kaggle dataset — rigorous methodology

name: Stripe: How We Built Radar
description: XGBoost→DNN migration, 85% training time reduction

name: PayPal: Graph Database for Fraud
description: Real-time fraud ring detection

name: LinkedIn: Defending Against Abuse at Scale
description: 4M+ TPS, multi-layer defense architecture

name: Meta: Few-Shot Learner for Harmful Content
description: Adapts to new threats in weeks, 100+ languages

name: Netflix: RAD Outlier Detection
description: Robust PCA at terabyte scale

name: Google Research: Self-Supervised Anomaly Detection
description: Contrastive learning, CutPaste algorithm

name: Stanford FinTech Lab: Rob Wang (Block)
description: Industry talk on fraud ML tradeoffs

name: KDD ML in Finance Workshop 2021
description: Talks from Georgia Tech, Harvard, Feedzai

name: IEEE-CIS Fraud: 1st Place Solution (Chris Deotte)
description: Kaggle Grandmaster, 262 features, RAPIDS GPU

name: scikit-learn: Outlier Detection
description: Isolation Forest, LOF, One-Class SVM comparison

name: imbalanced-learn: SMOTE
description: The standard for handling 1:10,000 class ratios

name: Federal Reserve SR 11-7
description: Model risk management standard all US banks follow

name: Google ML Recommendation Course
description: Free, 4 hours, candidate generation through re-ranking. Gold standard starter

name: HSE RecSys Course (GitHub)
description: Full course: collaborative filtering, matrix factorization, A/B testing

name: Fast.ai Lesson 7: Collaborative Filtering
description: Jeremy Howard's accessible deep dive, embeddings explained intuitively

name: Microsoft Recommenders Notebooks
description: Production-quality examples, scikit-learn style

name: StatQuest: Collaborative Filtering
description: Josh Starmer's visual, jargon-free explanation

name: Ritvikmath: Recommendation Systems
description: Clear math intuition without overwhelming notation

name: Jeremy Howard's Kaggle Deep Dive
description: Matrix factorization from scratch

name: TFRS Quickstart Colab
description: Movie recommender in minutes

name: Spotify Recommendations Explainer
description: Plain-language taste profiles

name: Netflix: How Recommendations Work
description: Official non-technical overview

name: IBM Collaborative Filtering
description: Authoritative enterprise perspective

name: Music Tomorrow: Spotify Deep Dive
description: Audio features, accessible depth

name: Introduction to Information Retrieval (Manning)
description: The canonical free textbook, Stanford

name: From RankNet to LambdaMART (Burges)
description: Definitive paper on learning-to-rank algorithms

name: Airbnb: Applying Deep Learning to Search
description: GBDT→DNN migration, what failed before it worked

name: Airbnb: Embedding-Based Retrieval
description: Two-tower architecture, largest ML lift in two years

name: Joachims: Unbiased Learning-to-Rank
description: Foundational paper on position bias correction

name: Deep Learning at Airbnb Search (QCon)
description: Malay Haldar's practitioner walkthrough

name: Georgia Tech (Ratliff): 10 Rules for Supply Chain Optimization
description: Practitioner checklist for scoping, data readiness, constraints, deployment — free PDF

name: Google OR-Tools: VRP + VRPTW Tutorial
description: Core logistics vocabulary (depot, fleet, constraints) with working Python baseline

name: DoorDash: ML + Optimization for Dispatch
description: Clearest 'real system' explanation: predictions feed optimizer, then simulation closes the loop

name: StatsForecast: Intermittent/Sparse Data Tutorial
description: Demand is often intermittent (lots of zeros) — learn baselines built for that

name: Forecasting: Principles and Practice, Python Edition
description: THE definitive resource — Hyndman's book adapted with Nixtlaverse Python code. Updated December 2025.

name: MIT OCW 14.384: Time Series Analysis
description: Graduate-level course with 26 lectures. ARMA, VAR, unit roots, cointegration, state-space, Kalman filters.

name: Penn State STAT 510: Applied Time Series Analysis
description: Free graduate course with 14 lessons. ARIMA, seasonal models, spectral analysis, VAR, ARCH/GARCH.

name: statsforecast Documentation (Nixtla)
description: AutoARIMA 19x faster than pmdarima. AutoETS, AutoTheta, MSTL, GARCH, Croston with distributed computing.

name: mlforecast Documentation (Nixtla)
description: ML-based forecasting with scikit-learn compatible interface. Lag features, rolling means, LightGBM/XGBoost.

name: Prophet Official Documentation
description: Meta's additive model for business seasonality. Component plots, holidays, custom seasonality.

name: Prophet Critique: Sean J. Taylor Retrospective
description: Honest assessment from Prophet co-creator: 'I do actually feel a bit of shame about the project.' Must-read.

name: Uber: Forecasting at Uber—An Introduction
description: ARIMA, Holt-Winters, exponential smoothing, Theta (M3 winner). Insights from M4 winner Slawek Smyl.

name: DoorDash: ELITE Ensemble Learning for Time Series
description: ELITE framework balancing accuracy vs. computational efficiency. Uses Ray for distributed forecasting.

name: Amazon Science: Chronos Foundation Model
description: State-of-the-art foundation model using T5 architecture. Zero-shot forecasting via token quantization.

name: Amazon Science: AutoGluon-TimeSeries
description: AutoML for forecasting in 3 lines of code. Outperforms best-in-hindsight on 29 benchmark datasets.

name: Instacart: Predicting Availability of 200M Grocery Items
description: XGBoost with 130 features scoring 200M+ items every 60 minutes. 15x items with 1/5 resources.

name: sktime: Unified Framework for ML with Time Series
description: Published at NeurIPS. Unified scikit-learn-like API for forecasting, pipelines, cross-validation.

name: scikit-learn: Lagged Features for Time Series
description: Official example using Polars for feature engineering with HistGradientBoostingRegressor.

name: MIT 15.053: Optimization Methods in Management Science
description: Undergraduate course on LP with geometry and visualization before algebra. Interactive spreadsheet exercises.

name: QuantEcon: Linear Programming Introduction
description: Python notebooks from Nobel Laureate Sargent. LP with economics applications using SciPy and OR-Tools.

name: Stanford CS229 Convex Optimization Overview
description: Zico Kolter's ML course supplement. Convex sets and functions with geometric intuition — ideal pre-Boyd prep.

name: Real Python: Linear Programming with Python
description: Comprehensive tutorial covering visualization, feasible regions, SciPy, PuLP, and mixed-integer programming.

name: SciPy Lecture Notes: Mathematical Optimization
description: Academic tutorial with visual explanations. Gradient descent, BFGS, Nelder-Mead with convergence visualizations.

name: PuLP Official Documentation
description: Complete LP/MIP documentation with case studies: blending problem, Sudoku, transportation. Multiple solver support.

name: Google OR-Tools Python Guide
description: Official documentation with setup and examples. CP-SAT solver won MiniZinc Challenge 2013-2024.

name: DoorDash: Next-Generation Dasher Dispatch Optimization
description: Rare solver benchmarking transparency — compares CBC, XPress, CPLEX, Gurobi (34x faster than CBC).

name: Uber: Dynamic Pricing and Matching in Ride-Hailing
description: Academic rigor with industry application. Joint optimization of pricing and matching.

name: MIT 6.046J Lecture 15: Linear Programming
description: Video intro from algorithmic perspective. LP formulation, reductions, and simplex method.

name: MIT 6.079: Introduction to Convex Optimization
description: Boyd's MIT course version with better self-study structure. Complete notes, problem sets, applications.

name: GILP: Geometric Interpretation of Linear Programs (Cornell)
description: Academic-grade visualization (ACM SIGCSE 2023). Shows feasible regions, simplex iterations, branch-and-bound.

name: Amazon Science: Operations Research and Optimization
description: Portal to Amazon's OR research on inventory planning, last-mile delivery, and fulfillment at massive scale.

name: Instacart: Delivering Optimal Shopping Experiences (Gurobi)
description: Why Instacart chose commercial solvers. Reliability and innovation speed from Gurobi.

name: The Cold Start Problem (Andrew Chen)
description: Atomic Networks and tipping points of two-sided marketplaces — why growth stalls

name: Lenny's Newsletter: How Duolingo Reignited User Growth
description: Case study on gamification, streaks, and retention mechanics that drove 4.5x growth

name: Causal Inference for the Brave and True
description: The best free intro to causal inference — DiD, IV, RDD with Python code

name: NFX Network Effects Manual
description: Comprehensive framework for 16 types of network effects — maps to marketplace growth

name: Growth Accounting & Backtraced Growth Accounting
description: Standard framework for user lifecycle states (New, Retained, Churned, Stale, Resurrected) with weighted backtrace views

name: Guide to Product Metrics
description: 26 metrics across AARRR framework: activation, retention, LTV, NRR, Quick Ratio, PMF Score explained

name: Measuring Product Health (Sequoia)
description: Definitive guide to growth, retention, stickiness & engagement metrics: DAU/MAU, Lness, cohort curves, Quick Ratio

name: Ken Norton: How to Hire a Product Manager
description: Former Google PM (14+ years) who led Docs, Calendar, Mobile Maps. This essay defines what a PM does by revealing hiring criteria — the map of competencies to develop.

name: SVPG: Product Management Start Here
description: Silicon Valley Product Group's curated entry point distinguishing 'empowered product teams' from 'feature teams' — exposes why most PM work is 'product management theater'.

name: Shreyas Doshi: LNO Framework
description: Former PM leader at Stripe, Twitter, Google. The LNO Framework (Leverage, Neutral, Overhead tasks) is a breakthrough prioritization model — distinguishes good from exceptional PM thinking.

name: Intercom: RICE Prioritization Framework
description: The RICE framework (Reach, Impact, Confidence, Effort) originated here and is now industry standard — provides quantitative structure for prioritization.

name: Intercom: On Product Management (Free Book)
description: Beautifully designed, practical product content from Intercom's product team led by Des Traynor. Free downloadable PDF covering PM fundamentals.

name: Gibson Biddle: DHM Product Strategy Framework
description: Former VP Product at Netflix (2005-2010). A 13-essay series walking through exactly how Netflix built its product strategy using DHM (Delight, Hard-to-copy, Margin-enhancing).

name: Teresa Torres: Opportunity Solution Trees
description: Product discovery coach who has trained 17,000+ PMs. The Opportunity Solution Tree framework connects business outcomes → customer opportunities → solutions → experiments.

name: Marty Cagan: INSPIRED
description: THE definitive book on modern product management from SVPG founder. Explains empowered teams, product discovery vs. delivery, and how Amazon, Google, Netflix actually operate.

name: Atlassian: How to Write Product Requirements
description: Practical guide to writing PRDs in an agile environment from the makers of Jira and Confluence. Includes templates and explains modern, lightweight documentation.

name: Amplitude: Product Lessons with Shreyas Doshi
description: Deep conversation on 'The Fundamental Framework of Product Work' (Impact, Execution, Optics levels) — demonstrates how metrics connect to strategy at sophisticated level.

name: Lenny's Newsletter & Podcast
description: Former Airbnb PM, #1 business newsletter on Substack with 700k+ subscribers. The most comprehensive ongoing resource for developing 'product sense' with concrete, tactical frameworks.

name: Spotify: Choosing a Sequential Testing Framework
description: Practical comparison of Group Sequential Tests (GST), mSPRT, GAVI, and corrected-alpha approaches with simulation results. Clarifies when to use each method.

name: Always Valid Inference: Continuous Monitoring of A/B Tests
description: Foundational paper on always-valid p-values and confidence intervals from Stanford/Optimizely. Solves the 'peeking problem' that invalidates most industry A/B tests.

name: Airbnb: Variance Reduction Using In-Experiment Data (KDD 2023)
description: Extends CUPED to use in-experiment data for variance reduction. Addresses delayed outcomes and sparse signals in marketplace experimentation with real booking flow examples.

name: Uber: Supercharging A/B Testing at Uber
description: Rebuilding experimentation from ground-up: logging architecture, statistics engine for A/B/N tests, metric recommendation, and flicker detection for 1,000+ concurrent experiments.

name: LinkedIn: A/B Testing Platform Technical Paper
description: 41,000+ simultaneous A/B tests on 700M+ members. Addresses network-specific challenges: viewer/viewee experiments, email experiments with selection bias, interaction effects.

name: Reducing Interference Bias in Marketplace Experiments (Holtz et al.)
description: Empirical evidence that standard experiments can overstate treatment effects by up to 100% in marketplace settings. Provides practical cluster randomization solutions.

name: 150 Successful ML Models at Booking.com (KDD 2019)
description: Reveals that model performance ≠ business performance. Demonstrates why RCTs are critical for validating ML models in production with framework for hypothesis-driven iteration.

name: Stitch Fix: Multi-Armed Bandits Integration
description: How to integrate Thompson Sampling and ε-greedy bandits into an existing A/B testing platform. Covers deterministic allocation via hashing and practical tradeoffs.

name: Booking.com: How to Increase Power with CUPED
description: The clearest practical CUPED explanation. Mathematical derivations with pseudo-code, theta calculation, and covariate adjustment. References the original Microsoft paper while making it accessible.

name: Netflix: A Survey of Causal Inference Applications
description: DiD, double ML, and Bayesian approaches across content, product, and member experience teams. Based on Netflix's internal Causal Inference Summit.

name: Delta Method in Metric Analytics (Microsoft/KDD 2018)
description: Comprehensive treatment for deriving variance for complex metrics (ratios, percentiles, quantiles). Parallelizable implementation for distributed systems — essential for production experimentation.

name: Design and Analysis of Switchback Experiments (Harvard/MIT)
description: Derives optimal switchback design under carryover effects using minimax optimization. Two inference approaches: exact randomization p-values and finite-population CLT. The theoretical foundation for marketplace experimentation.

name: CausalML: Uplift Modeling Package (Uber)
description: Meta-learners (S, T, X, R), uplift trees, CEVAE, DragonNet. 4,100+ GitHub stars, 2M+ PyPI downloads. KDD 2021 tutorial materials. Essential for heterogeneous treatment effects.

name: PyMC: Bayesian A/B Testing Tutorial
description: Full posterior distributions instead of point estimates. Beta-Binomial for conversions, Gamma-Poisson for continuous metrics. Directly answers 'probability B beats A' without frequentist constraints.

name: Choosing Your North Star Metric (Lenny/a16z)
description: Surveyed 40+ companies (Airbnb, Netflix, Spotify, Slack, Uber) for a taxonomy of 6 NSM categories. Frameworks for choosing based on business model type — the definitive NSM resource.

name: A Quantitative Approach to Product-Market Fit (Tribe Capital)
description: The foundational text on growth accounting. MAU growth accounting AND revenue growth accounting. Quick Ratio, Gross Retention, Net Churn explained by the team that pioneered it.

name: Guardrail Metrics for A/B Tests (PostHog)
description: Real examples from Airbnb's Experiment Guardrails Framework, Square, Bing, Netflix, eBay. The 3 categories: product-related, company-related, trustworthiness-related. Prevents metric gaming.

name: Retention (Sequoia Capital Data Science)
description: Three archetypal retention curves — Flattening, Declining, Smiling — and what each indicates about product health. Benchmarks by product type. Triangle retention chart visualization.

name: The Power User Curve (a16z)
description: The L30/L28 framework coined by Facebook's growth team. Why Power User Curves beat DAU/MAU: reveals variance, identifies power users, customizable for core actions. Used by a16z to evaluate startups.

name: How to Measure Cohort Retention (Lenny's Newsletter)
description: The most comprehensive retention measurement guide. SQL implementations, bounded vs unbounded retention definitions, visualization best practices. When to use X-day vs unbounded retention.

name: Ultimate Guide: Activation (Aakash Gupta)
description: Traces activation history from Facebook's 2008 growth team, including Chamath's '7 friends in 10 days' discovery. The Setup → Aha → Habit framework with data-backed examples.

name: How Superhuman Built an Engine to Find PMF (First Round)
description: Operationalizes Sean Ellis's '40% very disappointed' survey into a systematic process. How Superhuman went from 22% to 58% PMF score using segmentation. Most referenced First Round article.

name: Slack's 2000 Messages Activation Metric
description: Documents Slack's activation discovery — after 2,000 messages sent per team, 93% remain active. How they identified this leading indicator. Conversion rate significantly above 5% SaaS average.
